thread.title: EU privacy regulator fines Meta 251 million euros | The Star
thread.title_full: EU privacy regulator fines Meta 251 million euros | The Star

author: NA
title: EU privacy regulator fines Meta 251 million euros | The Star
text:
Technology Tuesday, 17 Dec 2024
9:27 PM MYT Related News Insight 16h ago New technology aids Brazil’s crackdown on illicit Amazon gold trade Drones 1d ago US agencies should use advanced technology to identify mysterious drones, Senator says Corporate News 1d ago MClean Technologies shareholders approve acquisition, capital restructuring plans FILE PHOTO: The logo of Meta Platforms' business group is seen in Brussels, Belgium December 6, 2022. REUTERS/Yves Herman/File Photo
DUBLIN (Reuters) - The lead European Union data privacy regulator for Meta fined the social media giant 251 million euros ($263.5 million) on Tuesday following two inquiries into a personal data breach.
The inquiry was opened six years ago after Meta notified Ireland's Data Protection Commission (DPC) of the breach that impacted around 29 million Facebook accounts globally, of which about 3 million were based in the EU.
Meta remedied the breach shortly after its discovery, the DPC said.
($1 = 0.9527 euros)
(Reporting by Padraic Halpin; Editing by Sachin Ravikumar)
